text: Hi, I've just created a new project website (after updating my local copy of Franklin to the latest version) and deployed to GitHub as a project webpage but the webpages appear to try to get the assets from the website root (`/assets`) rather than the project subdirectory (`/emat30008/assets`). What's the best way to fix this? I can't see any mention of any differences between project webpages and org webpages in the Franklin docs anymore (I know there used to be from when I set up my personal website previously). Thanks!

elements.text: Hi, I've just created a new project website (after updating my local copy of Franklin to the latest version) and deployed to GitHub as a project webpage but the webpages appear to try to get the assets from the website root (

). What's the best way to fix this? I can't see any mention of any differences between project webpages and org webpages in the Franklin docs anymore (I know there used to be from when I set up my personal website previously). Thanks!

text: This is <https://engmaths.github.io/emat30008/> in case that helps
:thinking_face: the deployment seems to have disappeared. It was there a few minutes ago. I'll have to come back to this later...

elements.text: the deployment seems to have disappeared. It was there a few minutes ago. I'll have to come back to this later...

text: check for the prepath? Give me a second I can look that up

elements.text: check for the prepath? Give me a second I can look that up

text: You need to define @def prepath="emat30008"  in your config.md

elements.text: You need to define @def prepath="emat30008"  in your config.md

text: Thanks Théo, that's what I had in mind!
